title: Fuels Engineer (Hybrid/ Remote)
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION  

Description**

The Civil and Environmental Practice seeks an enthusiastic and motivated Mechanical Engineer to join our growing and high performing Fuel System and Environmental Compliance Team based in Virginia Beach, VA. Responsibilities will include planning, executing, and documenting environmental compliance projects related to the storage and distribution of petroleum, oils, and lubricant (POL) facilities and infrastructure for a well-established client. This includes inventories, inspections and management plans for Petroleum Storage Tanks (PSTs) and related spill response and prevention activities and plans such as development of Spill Prevention Control and Countermeasures (SPCC) plans.


You will work as part of a multi-disciplinary, collaborative engineering team, with staff located in the Virginia Beach office and in other Michael Baker offices located across the United States (US). In addition, you will have several opportunities to travel across the US (including Alaska, Hawaii and territories) as well as internationally (including Europe, Asia and Africa) to various Department of Defense installations.


The successful candidate will be a motivated self-starter who displays a passion for solving complex problems for our clients, interacting in a team environment, and meeting established project requirements. Michael Baker is committed to the growth of our internal personnel and we support this with world class learning and development. Within the Fuel System and Environmental Compliance Team, the candidate will be mentored by seasoned project and program managers and have opportunities for career advancement. In addition, the successful candidate will have the personal satisfaction of completing activities to protect the environment we live in for our clients while protecting our military mission. As a company, We Make a Difference.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Supports a Project Team of engineers in planning, executing, and documenting environmental engineering projects.
* Prepares complex engineering studies supporting environmental engineering, planning, compliance, site evaluations, and corrective actions; prepares corrective action designs and specifications.
* Manages multiple complex technical projects as the primary task manager.
* Evaluates and develops technical scopes of work and cost estimates for unique project requirements.
* Evaluates the applicability of state and federal environmental regulations.
* Prepares documents for regulatory agencies to obtain required permits.
* Communicates with Project Team on technical and administrative requirements.
* Schedules and attends internal meetings as necessary and documents key decisions and action items.
* Prepares for site visits by evaluating project scopes of work and coordinating site work activities with onsite personnel and vendors.
* Completes site visits by traveling to sites to meet with clients and initiate, oversee, document, and troubleshoot the execution of environmental compliance work.
* Following site visits evaluates vendor reports of site work and prepare technical reports documenting the project scopes of work.
* Completes project technical requirements within established budgets and schedules.
* Performs quality assurance activities.
* Completes continuing education and training to maintain professional expertise and credentials.

**PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Bachelor of Science in Mechanical/ Civil Engineering or equivalent.
* 4 - 8 years of increasingly responsible engineering experience.
* Professional Engineer (P.E.) license required, or ability to obtain within 6-months.
* Experience in Department of Defense civil and environmental engineering and/or environmental compliance is REQUIRED, including bulk fuel storage and delivery system design or military service station fuel system design and construction as well as development of SPCC plans.
* Certification in tank and/or piping inspection (such as STI SP001/API 653/API 570) is also REQUIRED.
* Excellent technical writing and communications skills. Excellent skills in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat. Proficient skills in AutoCAD will also be considered.
* Site visits may require the ability to traverse uneven terrain wearing PPE(Personal Protection Equipment) and carrying light equipment necessary for data collection and reporting.
* Travel is required for this position and the individual must be legally authorized to work in the U.S., with a valid U.S. passport and eligible for security clearance. Travel requirements for this position are between 25-50% of the work schedule and include domestic destination and international destinations.

**COMPENSATION**

The approximate compensation range for this position is $94,000-$141,000. This compensation range is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting. Actual compensation is dependent upon factors such as education, qualifications, experience, skillset, and physical work location.


  
ABOUT US  

Michael Baker International, a leading provider of engineering and consulting services, including design, planning, architectural, environmental, construction and program management, has been solving some of the world’s most complex infrastructure challenges for more than 80 years with a legacy of expertise, experience, innovation and integrity.
  

  

Based in Pittsburgh and with nearly 100 offices nationwide, we partner with clients on everything from roads, bridges, tunnels, mass transit, and airports, to water treatment plants, arctic oil pipelines, environmental restoration and specialized overseas construction. We serve as a trusted adviser to the communities we serve, making them safer, more accessible, more sustainable and more prosperous.
  

  

We provide visionary leadership in facilitating transformational change for our clients. Our work delivers differentiating innovations and dedicated experts who challenge the status quo and share a world of diverse experience and an impassioned entrepreneurial spirit. We deliver quality of life.
  

  

We Make a Difference.
  

  

Michael Baker International is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Michael Baker International provides equal employment opportunity for all persons, in all facets of employment. Michael Baker International maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks. title: Director, Asset Performance (Remote)
description:
**Location:** Pittsburgh, PA
**Job Category:** Asset Performance
**Sub-Department:** SRMGTASSET
**Job ID:** 2177
**EQT is the United States largest producer of natural gas with a goal to reach Net Zero by or before 2025 (among the fastest in the industry).**


**From the office to the field, the #EQTeam is fueling the future. Power your potential with us.**



At EQT, we are making strides toward becoming the best producer by creating long-term value for all stakeholders, including employees, landowners, communities, industry partners and investors. Our vision is to evolve EQT into a modern, connected, digitally enabled organization.


With an incredibly collaborative culture and a determined, progressive workplace, EQT was both named a National Top Workplace, as well as one of Pittsburgh’s Best Places to Work!


**Join our Qrew!**



The Director of Asset Performance is responsible leading the day-to-day operations for Geology, Reservoir Engineering and Reserves sub departments for EQT. This includes overseeing the technical evaluations and workflows associated with base and wedge production forecasts, project economics analyses & optimization studies, asset performance input assumptions for A&D opportunities, subsurface reservoir engineering planning, science planning, well design analysis and geological evaluations and simulation studies. This position will directly lead cross-functional geology, reservoir engineering and reserves & system forecasting teams focused quantifying and maximizing the value of our assets. This position will support finance, accounting, production, completions, drilling, operations planning, corporate development and executive departments on projects and work requests, for we and corporate reserves evaluation and management. The Director will manage a team of staff members to support these efforts and will work directly with Senior Management to progress the company’s core strategies, maximize the value of our assets and realize the full potential of EQT!


**The Director, Asset Performance responsibilities include but are not limited to:**


* Responsible for the day-to-day operations of Asset Performance and execution of strategic initiatives and to ensure delivery of department goals
* Oversees Geology, Reservoir Engineering, and Reserves sub departments to ensure alignment within the Asset Performance department
* Manages and coordinates all AP sub departments and vendors
* Ensures reserves compliance by meeting both internal and external SEC guidelines and maintains the relationship with our reserve’s auditors
* Monitors the sub-department performance to ensure on-time delivery of projects and sets appropriate case priorities
* Leads asset evaluation opportunities to maximize the ultimate value of our assets
* Supports geologic modeling and reservoir simulations
* Provide regular updates to management on department performance, ensuring Qrew Metrics are being met and communicated clearly


**Required Experience and Skills:**


* 10-20 years of combined experience in oil and gas upstream exploration, new ventures, reservoir engineering, reservoir modeling and simulation, operations engineering in production or facilities
* Bachelor's degree in chemical, mechanical, or petroleum engineering OR master’s degree or higher in geosciences

**Preferred Experience and Skills:**


* Responsible for oversight of SEC proved reserves preparation and reporting and other intra-year reports.
* Expert in ARIES and experience with ComboCurve
* Ability to interpret lease operating statements, track business performance, and make course correction recommendations as needed.
* Background in reservoir simulation and/or technical reservoir engineering modeling and studies
* Must love technology and always on the hunt for hot tech to evolve the way we work and jack horsepower
* Leadership experience in unconventional geology, reservoir engineering, reserves, or asset teams
* Technical expert in unconventional reservoirs, in reservoir engineering and/or reserves
* Experience evaluating and underwriting A&D deals and leading discussions with bank groups
* Leadership exposure to creating and developing plans and lookbacks on science tests and reservoir studies
* Experience working Internal Audit and SOX Controls and independent Reserve Auditors


Remote work is approved for this role excluding the following states: Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Tennessee, Louisiana, New Jersey, and New York unless willing to relocate.

title: Lead Polymer Process Engineer
description:
**About Lygos**



Lygos is an industrial biotechnology company developing biobased sustainable solutions to improve everyday products. Our technology platform enables better economics and unlocks the power of sustainable specialty chemicals, enabling our partners to offer sustainable alternatives to legacy petroleum-based chemicals and materials. Lygos recently launched its Soltellus® polyaspartic acid product line with applications in personal care, home care, water treatment and agricultural applications. Ecoteria® products based on malonic acid derivatives have applications in fragrances as well as for coatings, adhesives, sealants and elastomers (CASE).


**About the Position**



We are seeking an experienced, motivated lead polymer process engineer to join our growing organization. As a member of the Operations team, you will initially report to the COO and be responsible for the process scale, technical support for our pre-commercial manufacturing activities and the engineering design for full-scale commercial production of our biodegradable functional polymers.



You will be responsible for developing process specifications, mass and energy balances, P&ID's and equipment specifications and be the lead Lygos representative for the biodegradable functional polymer process section on the 3rd party EPC team. This role will also have responsibility to plan and execute pilot scale trials to finalize equipment selection and sizing with equipment manufacturers, and shepherd the technology from development, through tech transfer into a cost effective and robust commercial design and ultimately into routine manufacturing operation.



You will also be responsible for detailed design and process modeling to underpin the detailed design and engineering activities for the commercial scale plant, including reaction engineering and process equipment preliminary design, among others. In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to our mission of producing sustainable products, enabling existing products to elevate their market share, and establishing new performance products and brands. You will also get to experience working in a collaborative team environment with multiple external partners, service providers and vendors.

  


**Role & Responsibilities:**


* Lead engineering responsibilities for the the functional polymer process area of the Lygos Biorefinery project.
* Scale up processes for producing functional polymers using internal and external resources.
* Prepare process flow diagrams, mass and energy balances, utility requirements, equipment specifications and techno-economic models for Lygos' processes to produce functional biodegradable water-soluble polymers and hydrogels.
* Work closely with analytical support staff to develop in-process and final product QC.
* Develop product specifications and quality control methods to ensure reliable product performance in target applications.
* Provide engineering and technical support to our current commercial manufacturing activities.
* Perform process development and scale-up testing to gather data for process design using internal resources, or by contracting with external labs/equipment vendors.
* Specify equipment for commercial production of polymers meeting techno-economic, capacity and product quality targets.
* Safely and efficiently transfer processes to commercial manufacturing sites.
* Support startup of the commercial equipment at the future Biorefinery for production of functional polymers.

  


**Qualifications & Experience:**


* BS/MS in Chemical Engineering with 8+ years of experience in chemical process development, process design, and/or specialty chemical manufacturing.
* Experience scaling up polymerization processes.
* Experience scaling up chemical processes from lab/pilot scale to manufacturing scale with a track record of successful translation of novel technology to commercial scale.
* Experience planning and executing pilot trials with contract manufacturing partners and/or equipment vendor aimed at selecting and sizing key unit operations.
* Solid fundamental knowledge of chemical engineering principles and unit operations, with specific emphasis on high viscosity polymer fundamentals, processes and equipment.
* Experience with engineering, start-up and operation of full-scale commercial project.
* Motivated self-starter with a sense of urgency that is comfortable in a fast-paced, multitasking environment.
* Superb organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills.
* Collaborative, analytical, and data-driven.
* The highest regard for safety, respect for people, and ethical behavior.
* Ability to travel for manufacturing support, vendor trials and EPC assignments(~40%)

  


**Nice-to-haves (but not required):**


* Experience with water soluble polymer applications in agricultural, water treatment and consumer product markets.
* A Masters or equivalent post-graduate experience in polymer engineering related to high viscosity water soluble polymer systems will be an advantage.
* Experience in processes and applications for hydrogels will be an added advantage.

  


***Compensation and Benefits:*** *Lygos offers highly competitive salaries, stock options, bonus and benefits, including medical and dental insurance, unlimited paid time off, and 401(k).*


*Salary: $165,000 - Actual pay will vary based on various factors, including but not limited to location, skill, experience, and performance.*

title: Process Equipment Design Engineer
description:

-------------------------

Day-to-day activities will include design, testing, and validation. This role will include participation in cross-functional teams such as those with a focus on facility design, chemical and electrochemical engineering, I&C and software engineering, process modeling, quality assurance, and licensing.

* Define process equipment architecture, specifications, operational modes, and performance criteria
* Benchmark lab and engineering-scale equipment design and performance
* Design, assemble, and operate prototypes to use for iterative design refinement
* Generate documentation guiding the fabrication, installation, commissioning, operation, and maintenance of process equipment
* Serve as process equipment technical lead through multiple lifecycle stages
* Generate technical documentation to be included in regulatory filings
* Document work using modern tools and techniques, and compose well-written, thoughtful technical reports

### **Competencies:**



We are looking for a Process Equipment Design Engineer that is:


* Passionate about clean energy
* Proficient in 3D modeling
* Motivated by building, and getting technology deployed
* Energized by tackling and overcoming challenges
* Passionate about making advanced fission a reality
* Willing and able to learn quickly
* Willing to think differently and do things in new ways
* Comfortable in a fast-paced, highly iterative startup environment
* Excited to think creatively, critically, and reflectively about the problems they are solving while not leaning only on what has been done before
* Willing to propose novel and creative solutions to technical problems
* Able to communicate technical content and results verbally
* An excellent writer who can write in a modern active voice, so make your cover letter compelling and write it well!

### **Minimum Qualifications:**


* Engineering education, potentially Mechanical, Materials, Petroleum, Aerospace, or Chemical
* Experience performing design or modification engineering on process equipment, such as that used in the petroleum, nuclear, petrochemical, or pharmaceutical industries
* Experience with CAD software
* Broad familiarity with engineering principles, and having strong systems engineering intuition

### **Bonus Qualifications:**


* Experience with electrochemical manufacturing processes such as electroplating or electrowinning
* Experience designing equipment for high (>500 C) temperature operation
* Experience with design for manufacturing, incorporating GD&T
* Experience with engineering simulation software, such as ANSYS

Job Title: Electrical Power Systems Engineer **Job Title: Electrical Power Systems Engineer**
Infinium is an electrofuels provider on a mission to decarbonize the world. Electrofuels are a new class of synthetic fuels made using renewable power and waste carbon dioxide, not petroleum or resources needed to produce food. Infinium electrofuels can be dropped into existing trucks, planes, and ships, significantly reducing harmful carbon dioxide emissions compared to fossil-based fuels. In addition to helping the transport industry meet carbon reduction goals, Infinium electrofuels are a lower carbon alternative for chemical processing, including plastics production. Learn why Amazon and other leading cleantech investors have chosen Infinium at www.infiniumco.com. **JOB SUMMARY:**
We are in search of a seasoned Electrical Power Systems Engineer to lead the design and development of electrical power systems for the Roadrunner project and other significant capital projects in collaboration with the execution organization. Electrical power systems are the heartbeat of the facility. This engineer will work on all aspects of the power system: including the high voltage utility tie-in, the high voltage substation, the medium voltage backbone to the end devices and power users working with a variety of contractors, vendors, and internal resources. You will report administratively to the Senior VP of Engineering but will work with the design team and the project managers. * Design, develop and optimize electrical power systems and deliverables for the organization
* Analyze and evaluate power distribution systems to support project objectives

* Develop project plans, budgets, and timelines for electrical power-related projects

 **YOU ARE:*** Generous of Spirit and Integrous
* Organized and Reliable
* Enthusiastic and Team Orientated
* Cogent and Inquisitive
* Creative and Adaptable
* Resilient and Supportive

 **YOU HAVE:*** An accredited degree in Electrical Engineering or the ability to demonstrate equivalence through experience and other education to successfully perform the role. Professional Engineering certification is a plus.
* Ten plus years of relevant experience in complex major capital projects involving bespoke design, technical designs in processing facilities and/or industrial substations.
* At least five years plus in design or project work for high voltage and medium voltage power distribution systems in a large complex project. Preference for experience in FEED, EPC, construction, start-up, and operations.

* Knowledge and familiarity with field installation, checkout, and commissioning/operational checks
* Demonstrated experience of being able to work in large complex teams, and managing or leading suppliers, vendors, and engineering contractors.
* Experience in both owner’s organization and EPC organization is a plus.
* Experience with specific electrical equipment frequently used in process industrial facilities such as cable systems, transformers, cable tray, specific switch gear, area classification, rectifiers, variable frequency drives, large 3-phase 4160V rotating equipment motors, GI breakers, and electric heaters are a plus.
* Having experience with revamps or brownfield projects would be helpful in being successful in this role.
* Have a broad experience to integrate the various parts of a large electrical systems project will be helpful in being successful in this role.
* A keen interest in learning, growing, and implementing your learning into all aspects of your work
* The ability to work independently, but also communicate and involve others as needed.
* This role is less about specific degrees or years of experience and more about direct relevant experiences. Candidates that can demonstrate that knowledge and experience will be more successful in this exciting opportunity. This role will require the candidate to oversee contractors work products but also do many of the direct work tasks needed to make the project successful. Knowing which areas need more oversite and which areas benefit from less owner oversight will help the candidate be more successful in this role.
* For candidates willing to work remotely, be able to demonstrate during the interview process how they have been successful in the past in a remote role, or a deep understanding of what they will need to do to be successful in a remote role.
* During the interview process, highlight how you align with the Infinium culture by contributing positively to an already high-performing team, emphasizing exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Success in this role necessitates a keen eye for detail and strong organizational skills.


**YOUR WORKING ENVIRONMENT:**
You are willing to work either in hybrid environment in Sacramento, Ca, or are an experienced remote worker willing to travel when the job demands it. In all cases you will be expected to visit suppliers, vendors, and contractors when needed and travel to the established project site when needed or to oversee critical milestones. This position does not post a percentage of travel, because the amount of travel varies by the individual, the status of the project, and the current issues and risks of the project that the engineer needs to manage. The ideal candidate is a technical authority in power distribution systems with demonstrated experience in both the contractor’s side and on the owner’s side or as an owner’s engineer. The ideal candidate has the intellectual curiosity to want to optimize the power distribution system to meet project objectives at the lowest cost, while also having the direct knowledge to inform decisions and be able to communicate to the VP and CEO of the company the drivers behind those decisions. Should that person also have some experience in an operating plant environment, which would help them be more successful as they could apply those experiences in this work to create stronger projects.
The ideal candidate is humbly confident in their knowledge and work, able to speak up and advocate for specific decisions in the project, while being flexible enough to internalize the needs and feedback from the project team in a gracious manner. The ideal candidate is willing to roll up their sleeves and support the team versus delegating everything to a contractor. The ideal candidate asks where they can help and finds alternatives when solving difficult problems supporting the team. POSITION SUMMARY

  

Purpose

  

Reporting to the Plant Manager, shift engineer is responsible for the day-to-day shift operation of the 2 SMRs, ASU, Syngas and integrated gas turbine plants based on the Air Products Kochi Plant and ensuring shift operating team to operate the plants safely and efficiently to facilitate attainment of the company’s standards.

  

Reporting to the Plant Manager, the shift engineer will ensure the smooth and reliable operation of all the operating units of the of the Air Products Kochi facility.

 **Nature and Scope**

  

The Kochi Plant is Air Products first fully owned and operated plant in India; it represents a significant investment and includes “State of the Art” technology which makes it the most advanced Hydrogen Plant within the Corporation.

  

The plant consists of 5 main elements: -

* 2 x Large Technip Steam Methane Reformers (SMR) with Air Products PSA’s for H2 purification.
* An 18 MW Kawasaki Gas Turbine, integrated with both reformers.
* An Air Products Air Separation Unit (ASU) Producing Nitrogen and Oxygen.
* Amine System for CO2 removal (aMDEA)
* Cryogenic separation and purification of CO.

  

The customer is Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd. (BPCL), Kochi refinery and the Air Products plant is located within the customer’s site. The products from the Air Products plants go directly to the customer as part of their refinery expansion. There is a high level of integration between BPCL and Air Products with respect to feedstock’s, products and utilities. The products are critical to refinery unit operations.

  

The plants run on continuous basis and there is a strong emphasis of high reliability and high efficiency with contractual penalties against Air Products for underperformance.

  

Air Products owns, operates and maintains Hydrogen Plants and ASUs around the globe with Operations in over 50 countries, in excess of 80 hydrogen plants and 350 ASU’s. As such we have a wealth of expertise and have well established work processes in place for the reliable and efficient operation of our plants.

description:
The driving force behind our success has always been the people of AspenTech. The Role
AspenTech is a leading supplier of software that optimizes process manufacturing – including oil and gas, petroleum, chemicals, pharmaceuticals and other industries that manufacture and produce products from a chemical process. With integrated Performance Engineering solutions, process manufacturers can implement best practices for optimizing their engineering, manufacturing and supply chain operations. As a result, AspenTech customers are better able to increase capacity, improve margins, reduce costs and become more energy efficient. In addition, the Asset Performance Management (APM) suite supports corporate reliability initiatives, taking an analytics-driven approach to asset availability. It combines deep process modeling expertise with real time big data to extend asset life and effectiveness. APM enables you to accurately predict and eliminate the root cause of all failures, so the only downtime you experience is the downtime you plan.  

  

We are looking to hire a Principal Solution Consultant with technical strength in Performance Engineering product suite for our Team in South Asia - India and position is based in Pune or Mumbai. This role is to assist our account managers to grow our business and support sales of the Performance Engineering solutions with a focus on process simulation, cost estimation and plant conceptual layout software for capital projects. We target capital project execution in chemicals, refining, and EPC industry clients. Key traits of the role are industry understanding, deep consultative skills, conceptual capital project execution (FEED, FEL 1-2), understanding of the AspenTech product strategy, and the ability to communicate effectively to both technical and management audiences. Refine the solution and vision messages for the overall project and work with other team members to develop presentation materials that effectively communicate these messages, leading clients to action.
* Participate and/or lead customer consulting engagements to facilitate sales, including demonstrations, workshops, value assessments, and technical seminars. Proactively support pipeline development (e.g. account planning, awareness sessions, workshops etc) and sales execution for assigned accounts and opportunities.
* Develop commercial proposals for assigned opportunities. Respond to RFI/RFQ/RFP questionnaires as required.
* Accountable for achieving personal targets such as productivity, bookings and other Solution Consulting related targets.
* Challenge customer’s current way of doing business to drive results.
* Strong drive to solve customer problems and rapidly convert pipeline opportunities into closed deals.
* Balance of business and technology acumen, including ability to articulate high-level technical solutions to business problems and the differentiated value those solutions can provide.
* Outstanding problem solving and analytical skills, including ability to create clear observations, analyses and conclusions based on customer interviews and data.
* Develop industry- and application-specific solutions for the customer. This is a very customer-facing position that will have you leading value discovery customer sessions, assessing customer needs, and developing solutions.
* Determine and understand prospective customer’s critical business issues in order to present and demonstrate AspenTech’s software capabilities as the best possible solution to win the business.
* Build customer-specific solutions on the AspenTech platform using all the available tool options.

* Develop & execute sales campaigns and plans together with the Sales teams.

At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future. As one of the world’s largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.

  

The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower-emissions technologies.

------------------------------------

title: Merchandise Flow Team Member
description:
Job summary


**Entity:**

Production & Operations **Job Family Group:**

Engineering Group **Job Summary:**

bp Technical Solutions India (TSI) center in Pune, aims to build on bp’s existing engineering and technical strengths to deliver high quality services to its hydrocarbons and new energy businesses worldwide! TSI brings together diverse engineering capability to provide technical services across a range of areas including engineering, maintenance, optimization, data processes, projects and subsurface, to deliver safe, affordable, and lower emission energy, while continuously innovating how we work!
  

Flow assurance team provides subsea flow assurance engineering expertise and judgement in support of engineering risk, integrity management and the delivery of safe, compliant, and efficient operations. **Job Description:**

**What you will deliver**

Support BP’s engineering application of tools and design methods for multiphase flow, in the context of Flow Assurance, through delivering or directly managing modelling of relevant flow scenarios.
Review, update, and apply flow assurance strategies to prevent line blockages or other production upsets and minimize operating downtime as conditions change through field life.
Perform multiphase flow and flow assurance analysis within an operational or project support context, understand the relationship between such work and key flow assurance decisions, and influence others to achieve desired objectives to mitigate flow assurance risks.
Deliver flow assurance data analysis and presentation within an operational or project support context to enable continuous improvement in operational support, performance management of flow assurance activity and reporting of key performance metrics.
Manage, coordinate and monitor flow assurance engineering contractors (on-site contract flow assurance engineers, or external suppliers), appropriate to the scale, complexity and business requirements of operating regions.
Challenge, priorities and plan work requests to meet operational delivery schedule and quality.
Engage key partners as appropriate to convey understanding of multiphase flow and its relevance to their context, developing and maintaining positive working relationships representing the flow assurance discipline across regions.
Provide flow assurance operating philosophies to be implemented by others, including chemical or operational requirements for both steady state and transient conditions (start-up and shut down). Ensure that the Operating Guidelines and Procedures embody these strategies and solutions.
Develop solutions to complex flow assurance problems that will improve safety, production efficiency and cost effectiveness.
**What you will need to be successful**

**Must have education / certifications:**


Bachelor’s or master’s Degree in a relevant science or engineering field (chemical, mechanical or petroleum engineering).
Working towards chartered engineer
**Must have experience / skills (to be hired with):**

5 – 10 years of experience
